subTitle: Explore frequently asked questions for clear and concise answers about Assertive, our autonomous testing software

faqs.question: What is Assertive?
faqs.answer: Assertive is an autonomous testing tool that allows developers to easily test their software using advanced code analysis and reinforcement learning, yielding targeted unit tests with vastly better coverage than traditional methods. When potential bugs are detected, users are provided with a suggested patch.

faqs.question: Can I use this for free?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Assertive offers a free Community Edition that provides users with a limited number of tests and bug prevention suggestions. For more advanced features, we offer a paid subscription.

faqs.question: What languages does Assertive work with?
faqs.answer: Assertive currently supports Java and Kotlin. We plan to add support for other languages in the near future, including Python, Typescript, Javascript and C#, along with personalized VSCode integration.

faqs.question: What data does Assertive use to generate tests?
faqs.answer: Assertive only uses the code you provide it to perform extensive analysis to generate tests, deleting this data once complete. Assertive also records run-data from Community Edition users in a secure, encrypted database, which we leverage for debugging and product improvement.

faqs.question: Will my code be shared with others?
